page.topic: Retrieving a Pointer to a Control
page.description: There are several ways to get the pointer to the control. The first way is to use the .CHILD() method and name the control. These examples refer to a button control, but other types of controls work the same way.

section.example: dim ptr as P dim fld as P ptr = form.load("Customer Information") ptr.show() fld = ptr.child("BUTTON3") fld.BUTTON_METHOD(arguments) ' now do something with the pointer

section.description: If you are writing code to respond to a button event, such as OnPush, you can use the this.this technique to retrieve the pointer. The next example uses the pointer to read the .TEXT property of the button.
section.note: The first this says "me" or "my". The second this says "pointer". The result is "my pointer".

section.example: dim ctrl as P ctrl = this.this ui_msg_box("Button4", "The caption of Button4 is " + ctrl.text)
